action.content:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

rental

Related words are:

- rent
- reimbursement
- overpayment

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

CLUE: Objects or spaces temporarily given in exchange for payment. GUESS: I'm thinking of something that can be borrowed for a fee.

CLUE: Process of giving something for use in exchange for compensation. GUESS: I'm thinking of an action where you pay to use something.

CLUE: Money returned for something previously paid. GUESS: I'm thinking of a refund or repayment of money.

Last

objects or spaces temporarily given in exchange for payment guess im thinking of something that can be borrowed for a fee

 process of giving something for use in exchange for compensation guess im thinking of an action where you pay to use something

 money returned for something previously paid guess im thinking of a refund or repayment of money

last

You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: Objects or spaces temporarily given in exchange for payment. GUESS: I'm thinking of something that can be borrowed for a fee.

CLUE: Process of giving something for use in exchange for compensation. GUESS: I'm thinking of an action where you pay to use something.

CLUE: Money returned for something previously paid. GUESS: I'm thinking of a refund or repayment of money.

Last

CLUE: Commonly involves a contract or agreement. GUESS: I'm thinking of a legal agreement or transaction involving payment.

CLUE: Can be a good or a service. GUESS: I'm thinking of something that can be bought or sold, it could be a good or a service.

CLUE: Often involves a store or marketplace. GUESS: I'm thinking of a place where goods or services are bought and sold.
